New Records: Keider Montero threw a shutout in fewer than 100 pitches
Key Match Events: Montero struck out Jordan Beck of the Colorado Rockies on his 96th pitch of the evening
Montero gave up three hits and walked no batters on the night
Montero induced three double plays, meaning he faced the minimum 27 batters
Pre-Game Insights: Tigers manager A.J. Hinch emphasized the importance of Montero's growth in confidence
Montero has been working on his mechanics and pitch mix
Post-Match Reflections: Montero expressed pride and happiness for the team's performance
Tigers manager A.J. Hinch highlighted Montero's contribution to the team's success over the past two months
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dillon Dingler was scratched with illness only a couple of hours before game time
Parker Meadows noted that this was the best he has ever seen Montero pitch
